description.value:
Kaarghaz makes three attacks: one with his bite and two with his claws.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d4 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d4 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Chameleon Skin. Kaarghaz has advantage on &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} (&Reference[ste]{Stealth}) checks made to hide.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Stench. Any creature other than a troglodyte that starts its turn within 5 feet of Kaarghaz must succeed on a [[/save con 12 format=long]] or be &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} until the start of the creature’s next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all troglodytes for 1 hour.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Sunlight Sensitivity. While in sunlight, Kaarghaz has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Spellcasting. Kaarghaz is a 4th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is &Reference[cha]{Charisma} (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). He knows the following sorcerer spells:

Cantrips (at will): &Reference[fire]{fire} bolt, mage hand, &Reference[poison]{poison} spray, prestidigitation, ray of frost

1st level (6 slots): burning hands, shield, sleep

2nd level (3 slots): invisibility, scorching ray

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

You hurl a mote of &Reference[fire]{fire} at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

This spell's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

You can use your action to control the hand. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

You extend your hand toward a creature you can see within range and project a puff of noxious gas from your palm. The creature must succeed on a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw or take 1d12 &Reference[poison]{poison} damage.

This spell's damage increases by 1d12 when you reach 5th level (2d12), 11th level (3d12), and 17th level (4d12).

This spell is a minor magical trick that novice spellcasters use for practice. You create one of the following magical effects within range:

  • You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.
  • You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
  • You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.
  • You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving &Reference[material]{material} for 1 hour.
  • You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.
  • You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand and that lasts until the end of your next turn.


If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

A frigid beam of blue-white light streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes 1d8 &Reference[cold]{cold} damage, and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

As you hold your hands with thumbs touching and fingers spread, a thin sheet of flames shoots forth from your outstretched fingertips. Each creature in a 15-foot &Reference[cone]{cone} must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. A creature takes 3d6 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The &Reference[fire]{fire} ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

An &Reference[invisible]{invisible} barrier of magical &Reference[force]{force} appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

activation.condition: which you take when you are hit by an attack or targeted by the magic missile spell

description.value:
This spell sends creatures into a magical slumber. Roll 5d8; the total is how many hit points of creatures this spell can affect. Creatures within 20 feet of a point you choose within range are affected in ascending order of their current hit points (ignoring &Reference[unconscious]{unconscious} creatures).

Starting with the creature that has the lowest current hit points, each creature affected by this spell falls &Reference[unconscious]{unconscious} until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake. Subtract each creature’s hit points from the total before moving on to the creature with the next lowest hit points. A creature’s hit points must be equal to or less than the remaining total for that creature to be affected.

&Reference[undead]{Undead} and creatures immune to being &Reference[charmed]{charmed} aren’t affected by this spell.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, roll an additional 2d8 for each slot level above 1st.

materials.value: a pinch of fine sand, rose petals, or a cricket

macro.name: Sleep

description.value:
A creature you touch becomes &Reference[invisible]{invisible} until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is &Reference[invisible]{invisible} as long as it is on the target's person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

materials.value: an eyelash encased in gum arabic

description.value:
You create three rays of &Reference[fire]{fire} and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several.

Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional ray for each slot level above 2nd.
